citations.narrative:
Housekeeping. There is still a buildup of cobwebs, dust, dirt and debris on windows, window ledges, empty enclosures,
and supports in the animal room. Animal facilities must be kept clean to ensure good quality of the air for the animals and
to prevent unnecessary disease risks. Ineffective cleaning and housekeeping can expose the guinea pigs to disease risks
and health problems. Correct by keeping the premises clean, including: removing the buildup of dust, dirt, cobwebs, and
debris; routinely dusting off and cleaning surfaces in the animal room; and maintaining a level of general cleanliness to
support good animal husbandry and health.
Remains uncorrected.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
3.31(b)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
Housekeeping. There is still a buildup of cobwebs, dust, dirt and debris on windows, window ledges, empty enclosures, 
and supports in the animal room. Animal facilities must be kept clean to ensure good quality of the air for the animals and 
to prevent unnecessary disease risks. Ineffective cleaning and housekeeping can expose the guinea pigs to disease  risks 
and health problems. Correct by keeping the premises clean, including: removing the buildup of dust, dirt, cobwebs, and 
debris; routinely dusting off and cleaning surfaces in the animal room; and maintaining a level of general cleanliness to 
support good animal husbandry and health. 
Remains uncorrected. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
